titleStmt.title: C. B. Davis to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG4902

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
London Ky 19th April 1864
E. L. Vanwinkle
Dr. Sir Son

Some time about the last of March I forwarded to the address of Govr. Bramlett the Petitions of John Pitman Jonathan McNeill and E S McNeill, asking to be relieved from the payment of fines adjudged against them at the March Term of the Laurel Circuit Court 1864

A short time afterward I also forwarded the petition of Mike Wyrick for a similar purpose and remittances in his cases was returned immediately, never having received anything in regard to the first named petition I fear they have been lost in the mails
Will you be so kind as to drop me a line in reference to the matter.

E L Vanwinkle
Secty State
Frankfort
Ky
